content: DP Bill Heats Up in Nevada A domestic-partnership bill that could establish many rights for Nevada same-sex couples was introduced in the state legislature, but the governor has said he will veto it. "I just don't believe in it," Republican governor Jim Gibbons (pictured) said on Tuesday, according to the Las Vegas Review-Journal. The bill was introduced by David Parks, a state senator from Las Vegas. The full senate will vote on it in the next few days. If the bill were to become law, same-sex and opposite-sex couples would be able to register their relationships with the secretary of state’s office and be granted tax and visitation rights that are currently unavailable to them. >http://www.advocate.com/news_detail_ektid79090.asp

title: DP Bill Heats Up in Nevada

content: It's hard to believe the Gov. of Nevada doesn't "...believe in it" Does he think its a myth? And in the sin state of Union, no less. It never ceases to amaze me that God has not wiped Nevada off the map. New Orleans gets bashed by god because they planned a gay parade (so say the fundies) but Nevada goes on unmolested by mother natures godly revenge. Maybe recognizing gay marriage will finally do it?
